body:
# 1.0.5

## 🐞 Bug fix

https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/270 Support count parameter for LPOP and RPOP (thanks, @bluecontainer!)

## 💼 Maintenance

Dependencies updates

# 1.0.4

## 🐞 Bug fix

https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/pull/263 Fix handling of curly braces in KEYS (thanks, @dev-hanz-ops!)

## 💼 Maintenance

Dependencies updates

## 🚀 New features

* `HSTRLEN` command supported
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/178  Add support for non-localhost IPs for starting Mocking server

## 🐞 Bug fixes 

Thanks @newacct for reporting the bugs!

* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/188 GET fails on HyperLogLog key
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/218 ZREVRANGEBYSCORE doesn't work
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/219 ZRANGEBYSCORE LIMIT doesn't follow ordering
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/220 ZRANGEBYSCORE does not correctly interpret -inf
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/233 String values and zset values do not store non-UTF8 binary values properly
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/234 ZRANGEBYSCORE fails when bounds are out of order
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/235 ZCARD incorrect result after ZREMRANGEBYSCORE
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/236 HyperLogLog GET does not get same bytes as SET
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/241 SETNX, SETEX, MSET, GETSET do not handle non-UTF8 binary data properly
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/244 SET with empty value doesn't work 

## 💼 Maintenance 

* Refactoring of the classes for internal data structures (especially for Sorted Sets)
* Dependencies are updated

## 🚀 New commands

* `ZREVRANGE`,  `ZREVRANGEBYSCORE` per https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/177

## 🐞 Bug fixes 

Thanks @newacct for reporting the bugs!

* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/185 HLEN fails when key does not exist
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/186 ZRANGE returns incorrect order for elements with the same score
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/187 HSET after EXPIRE discards the expiration
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/189 SETBIT clears other bits
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/191 HKEYS/HVALS/HGETALL fails when key does not exist
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/192 HDEL does not work on additional arguments
* https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/202 When calling RedisServer.stop, disconnect existing clients (thanks @bluecontainer!)

### Bug fixes

* #172 (Messages sent to subsribe twice, degradation since 1.0.0)

### New commands

* `zcount` #171

🥳 🍾 This is a major release made as a result of a semester work of the following nice people (in alphabetic order):

* @aleksandr1101,
* @gogagum,
* @Julia-st96,
* @pekashy 

## New features
`RedisCommandInterceptor` introduced, allowing users to intercept calls to jedis-mock and 
* perform additional verifications 
* stub the replies for unsupported operations
* generally use jedis-mock as a testing proxy

## New supported operations
* `PSUBSCRIBE` and `PUNSUBSCRIBE` (#26)
* `PUBSUB CHANNELS`
* `PUBSUB NUMPAT`
* `PERSIST`  (#53)
* `WATCH` and `UNWATCH` (#80)
* `DISCARD`

## Bug fixes
* Fixed concurrency code. Multiple issues  randomly occured in multithreaded environment are expected to be gone.
* `subscribe` didn't work for multiple channels

## Maintenance
* Major code clean up:
   * Operation classes are categorized, put to separate packages and are being registered automatically in runtime.
   * Tests are categorized and put to separate packages.
* Google Guava dependency removed.
* Do not use serialization for internal storage of data structures.
* Automatic report with list of supported and unsupported operations introduced.
* Dependabot introduced. All the Maven dependencies are now automatically  updated to their latest versions.
* Upgraded reference Redis version to 6.2

## Extended parameters for `SET` method supported
* [`SET EX|PX NX|XX`](https://redis.io/commands/set) (fix #91)

name: Release 0.1.22
body:
## New method supported 
* [`TYPE`](https://redis.io/commands/type) (fix #139)

name: Release 0.1.21
body:
# Bug fix

* #135 RedisClient not closed when user forgot to `quit`

name: Release 0.1.20
body:
## Bug fixes

* #121 [`flushall`](https://redis.io/commands/flushall) doesn't clear all the databases
* #122 `keys` and `scan` don't take into account key expirations

## New methods supported

* [`zrevrangebylex`](https://redis.io/commands/zrevrangebylex) (thanks @checkpoint20!)
* [`hscan`](https://redis.io/commands/hscan)

name: Release 0.1.19
body:
Bug fixes

* `ZREMRANGEBYSCORE` does not work for negative scores (#116) * `INCRBYFLOAT` invocation causes exception with message "`Long` cannot be cast to `[B`" * When `HINCRBYFLOAT` is called with int parameter on int value, it should return int (thanks @24kpure for the fix provided in #101)

Newly Supported Operations

* [`ZRANGEBYSCORE`](https://redis.io/commands/zrangebyscore) * [`HELLO`](https://redis.io/commands/hello) always returns `proto, 2` in order to support LettuceClient (#104)

name: Release 0.1.18
body:
Special thanks to

@mwiede @fxshlein @mpetricek-corp @fluffy88 @etolbakov

Bug fix

* hsetnx is not returning 0 if field already exists (https://github.com/fppt/jedis-mock/issues/97)

Changes

* We now use TestContainers and Redis 5.0 as a comarison base * Jedis is updated to 3.6.0

Newly Supported Operations

* [`HSET`](https://redis.io/commands/hset) now supports `Map` as a parameter in order to set multiple sub-keys at once * [`CLIENT SETNAME`](https://redis.io/commands/client-setname) is now mocked according to the specification (just returns 'OK') * [`ZREMRANGEBYSCORE`](https://redis.io/commands/zremrangebyscore)

name: Release 0.17.0
body: Release with client support and to test release pipeline still working

name: Release 0.1.16
body:
Special thanks to:

- [@davidkus](https://github.com/davidkus) 
- [@bilbo2](https://github.com/bilbo2) 
- [@demarna1](https://github.com/demarna1) 
- [@mattsheppard](https://github.com/mattsheppard) 

For all the new features, fixes, and geniune awesomeness. Thanks folks! 

### Bug Fix:

- `incr` was incorrectly clearing ttl - fixed
- Flaky test, massive thanks here. That one was bothering me. 

### Newly Supported Operations

- `hlen` - https://redis.io/commands/hlen
- `zrangebylex ` - https://redis.io/commands/zrangebylex
- `auth` - https://redis.io/commands/auth (no password support yet)

name: Release 0.1.15
body:
Special thanks to [@imanzano](https://github.com/imanzano) for the fix. 

### Bug Fix:

- `rpoplpush` returning incorrect results when source is empty

name: Release 0.1.14
body:
Special thanks to [@youngasimov](https://github.com/youngasimov), [davidkus](https://github.com/davidkus) and [sebastien-guay](https://github.com/sebastien-guay) who did all the work for this release.

Nice one folks!

### New Methods Supported

- `zcard ` - https://redis.io/commands/zcard
- `hkeys ` - https://redis.io/commands/hkeys
- `sscan ` - https://redis.io/commands/sscan

### Other Changes

- `WITHSCORES` on `zrange`

Nice one folks!

body:

name: Release 0.1.11
body:
Special thanks to [@patpod](https://github.com/patpod) who did all the work for this release.

### Hotfix Release

Fixed ConcurrentModificationException when deleting hashes with more than one field

name: Release 0.1.10
body:
Special thanks to [@inponomarev](https://github.com/inponomarev) who did all the work for this release.

### New Methods Supported

- `scard` - https://redis.io/commands/scard
- `srem` - https://redis.io/commands/srem
- `time` - https://redis.io/commands/time

### Other Changes

- Fixed bug in sadd. This command should return the number of added entries, not the size of resulting set.
- Fixed bug in exists. Always returned false for HMAPs.
- Fixed bug in del. It didn't delete HMAPs.

name: Release 0.1.9
body:
### New Methods Supported

- `info` - https://redis.io/commands/info
- `hsetnx` - https://redis.io/commands/hsetnx
- `select` - https://redis.io/commands/select

### Other Changes

- Cleanup internal operation building
- Cleanup packages
- Disabled cluster functionality as it was not fully tested and buggy at times

name: Release 0.1.6
body:
This is a continued support release from the original repository. No new features at this time but I am looking for suggestions to help improve this library.

Thanks to all for their patience in letting me sort this out.
